attributes.action: Keep the triple lock uplift for state pensions
attributes.additional_details: Over recent years the anticipated 8% increase would be the most pensioners have ever received. It is not as though this figure is likely to be more than a "one off" increase.  This would be a matter of "changing the goal posts" because of a one time larger cost.  The pensioners in the UK already receive a pittance compared with other countries in Europe and also have to pay into the system for more years in order to qualify.  Scrap this very bad idea - it is a non-starter and a vote loser.
attributes.background: Do not remove the triple lock pension uplift for state pensions.
